Comments_List: I learned a lot of knowledge of neuroscience through lectures given by great professors. By writing essays, I improved my writing skills and my critical thinking.

Critical reading and writing, class discussion
General knowledge about various fields in neuroscience
How to read papers in depth, critically question methods and interpretation of results, how to write in a condensed manner

I gained a broader view of the way in which questions and advances from systems neuroscience. Previously, I had little experience with electrophysiology. These discussion-based seminars exposed me to articles written by established system neuroscientists. I also improved my writing as a scientist.

The strengths are that we can discuss with professors and get feedback from instructors. The weaknesses are that the lectures are almost related only to system neuroscience. Maybe next time we can have some molecular or cellular neuroscience.
Learned a lot, but maybe the order of lecturers could be improved and in-class discussions could be more structured

Strengths: Both a depth and breadth of inquiry. Good mixture between discussion and lecture format. Beneficial instructor input without dominating class format. Interesting guest lecturers

Weaknesses: N/A

Strengths: Discussions, lectures
Weaknesses: It was hard to engage if my level of critical thinking was at or exceeding course expectations. The feedback on the essays was great, but I was not sure how I was doing in the course.
Yes, the courses can help students form a systematic knowledge of neuroscience and improve their writing skills and critical thinking.
Provides a good foundation for critical reading and writing
Yes, for all of the reasons listed in the strengths section. It is challenging but extremely useful
Yes, it was a wonderful intro to an array of topics in neuroscience and the faculty across the INP department.

Yes. I recommend this course for those who aspire to write grants and articles in the future. In this course, I was forced to challenge myself and think outside of the box. All STEM graduate students should take this course or a seminar course similar to this.
